comments: a(n) is the number of ways to select a nonempty proper subset from each block of the set partitions of {1,2,...,n}. - Geoffrey Critzer, Jan 20 2012
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..200
INRIA Algorithms Project, Encyclopedia of Combinatorial Structures 827
formula: E.g.f.: exp(exp(x)^2-2*exp(x)+1).Stirling transform of unsigned Hermite numbers: Sum_{k=0..n} Stirling2(n, k)*|HermiteH(k, 0)|. - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Sep 12 2003
mathematica: nn=20; a=Exp[x]-1; Range[0,nn]! CoefficientList[Series[Exp[a^2], {x,0,nn}], x]  (* _Geoffrey Critzer_, Jan 20 2012 *)
author: encyclopedia(AT)pommard.inria.fr, Jan 25 2000
